content.div:
Platform: X360

How does one truly define "Insanely Twisted Shadow Planet"? To simply call it a 2-D side-scrolling action game would be a horrible disservice. This generic definition would fail to capture the game's creepy art style, extreme depth of play and bizarre creatures. With all of these pieces in mind, I would have to say that the game is best summed up as H.P. Lovecraft meets "Metroid" -- and that's a match made in heaven.

The concept is simple: Guide a UFO through the treacherous and twisted landscapes of an alien planet. While there are many creatures and obstacles bent on stopping you, don't fret. You'll have an arsenal of your own to help you smash, grab and shoot through just about anything.

The game's environments have been lovingly crafted by artist Michel Gagne, making it as much a visual experience as it is an interactive one. Every portion of the screen, from crawling creatures in the background to enormous spinning death traps, creates a sense of fear and curiosity as you explore this strange alien world. It is this artistic achievement that makes the game stand out among its peers.
